mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, James Hollingsworth to Lily Macalester Laughton, 1880 December 9
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hollingsworth, John McHenry, 1823-1889
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from James Hollingsworth, superintendent, to Lily Macalester Laughton, Regent, December 9, 1880. Mount Vernon. Explains difference in payroll caused by hirings, firings and increases in salary. West Ford's son married to white woman and moved into porter's lodge without permission. Dismissed him at once. Weather very cold, ice on river. Not as strong as before his attack. Postscript on December 15. Sends estimates for new road. Filling ice house.
